verses.verse: (For the choir director, for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.) I said, <S%H559><s%> "I will guard <S%H8104><s%> my ways, <S%H1870><s%> That I may not sin <S%H2398><s%> with my tongue; <S%H3956><s%> I will guard <S%H8104><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> as with a muzzle, <S%H4269><s%> While <S%H5750><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> are in my presence. <S%H5048><s%>"
I was dumb <S%H481><s%> and silent, <S%H1747><s%> I refrained <S%H2814><s%> [even] from good; <S%H9185><s%> And my sorrow <S%H3511><s%> grew <S%H5916><s%> worse. <S%H5916><s%>

My heart <S%H3820><s%> was hot <S%H2552><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me; While I was musing <S%H1901><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> burned; <S%H1197><s%> [Then] I spoke <S%H1696><s%> with my tongue: <S%H3956><s%>

"Lord, <S%H3068><s%> make me to know <S%H3045><s%> my end, <S%H7093><s%> And what <S%H4100><s%> is the extent <S%H4060><s%> of my days, <S%H3117><s%> Let me know <S%H3045><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> transient <S%H2310><s%> I am.

"Behold, <S%H2009><s%> Thou hast made <S%H5414><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> [as] handbreadths, <S%H2947><s%> And my lifetime <S%H2465><s%> as nothing <S%H369><s%> in Thy sight, <S%H5048><s%> Surely <S%H389><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H120><s%> at his best <S%H5324><s%> is a mere <S%H3605><s%> breath. <S%H1892><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

"Surely <S%H389><s%> every <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> about as a phantom; <S%H6754><s%> Surely <S%H389><s%> they make <S%H1993><s%> an uproar <S%H1993><s%> for nothing; <S%H1892><s%> He amasses <S%H6651><s%> [riches], and does not know <S%H3045><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> will gather <S%H622><s%> them.
"And now, <S%H6258><s%> Lord, <S%H136><s%> for what <S%H4100><s%> do I wait <S%H6960><s%>? My hope <S%H8431><s%> is in Thee.
"Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from all <S%H3605><s%> my transgressions; <S%H6588><s%> Make <S%H7760><s%> me not the reproach <S%H2781><s%> of the foolish. <S%H5036><s%>
"I have become <S%H481><s%> dumb, <S%H481><s%> I do not open <S%H6605><s%> my mouth, <S%H6310><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> it is Thou who hast done <S%H6213><s%> [it.]
"Remove <S%H5493><s%> Thy plague <S%H5061><s%> from me; Because <S%H4480><s%> of the opposition <S%H8409><s%> of Thy hand, <S%H3027><s%> I am perishing. <S%H3615><s%>

"With reproofs <S%H9640><s%> Thou dost chasten <S%H3256><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> for iniquity; <S%H5771><s%> Thou dost consume <S%H4529><s%> as a moth <S%H6211><s%> what is precious <S%H2530><s%> to him; Surely <S%H389><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H120><s%> is a mere <S%H1892><s%> breath. <S%H1892><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

"Hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer, <S%H8605><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and give <S%H238><s%> ear <S%H238><s%> to my cry; <S%H7775><s%> Do not be silent <S%H2790><s%> at my tears; <S%H1832><s%> For I am a stranger <S%H1616><s%> with Thee, A sojourner <S%H8453><s%> like all <S%H3605><s%> my fathers.
"Turn <S%H8159><s%> Thy gaze <S%H8159><s%> away <S%H8159><s%> from me, that I may smile <S%H1082><s%> [again], Before <S%H2962><s%> I depart <S%H1980><s%> and am no <S%H369><s%> more. <S%H369><s%>"
